headline: New Alzheimer's Drug Shows Promise in Slowing Cognitive Decline
snippet: Lecanemab demonstrates significant reduction in amyloid plaques and slowing of cognitive decline in early Alzheimer's patients in Phase 3 clinical trial.

headline: Blood Test for Alzheimer's Biomarkers Reaches 95% Accuracy
snippet: New plasma-based biomarker test detects tau and amyloid proteins with high precision, offering accessible early diagnosis for Alzheimer's disease.

headline: FDA Approves First Digital Therapeutic for Dementia Symptoms
snippet: Prescription digital therapeutic using cognitive training exercises shows efficacy in improving memory and executive function in mild cognitive impairment.

headline: Study Links Gut Microbiome Changes to Alzheimer's Progression
snippet: Research identifies specific gut bacteria alterations associated with increased amyloid deposition and neuroinflammation in Alzheimer's patients.

headline: Novel Tau PET Tracer Improves Early Detection Accuracy
snippet: Next-generation tau PET imaging agent provides superior visualization of neurofibrillary tangles, enhancing differential diagnosis of tauopathies.

headline: Genetic Risk Scores Predict Dementia Onset 10 Years in Advance
snippet: Polygenic risk scoring system combining 50+ genetic variants accurately predicts Alzheimer's disease development with 85% specificity in middle-aged adults.

headline: Deep Learning Model Detects Dementia from MRI Scans with 98% Accuracy
snippet: AI algorithm analyzes structural MRI data to identify early-stage dementia patterns, outperforming traditional radiological assessment methods.

headline: Anti-inflammatory Drug Shows Neuroprotective Effects in Vascular Dementia
snippet: Clinical trial demonstrates that targeted anti-inflammatory treatment reduces white matter hyperintensities and improves cognitive function in vascular dementia.

headline: Sleep Disruption Identified as Key Modifiable Risk Factor for Dementia
snippet: Longitudinal study confirms that chronic sleep fragmentation accelerates amyloid accumulation and increases dementia risk by 45% in older adults.

headline: Novel Drug Combination Reverses Synaptic Loss in Alzheimer's Models
snippet: Preclinical study shows that combined targeting of amyloid and tau pathways restores synaptic density and improves cognitive function in animal models.
